newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka raises tea export tax to 2.50 rupees/kg.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka raises tea export tax to 2.50 rupees/kg.

text.p: Sri Lanka's Tea Board has raised a tax levied on tea exports to 2.50 rupees ($0.04) per kg from two rupees per kg, a Plantation Industries Ministry official said on Wednesday.

"We increased the cess because it had not been increased in the last five years," the official said. "In the meantime the cost of the development work funded through the cess had gone up." The increase is effective from April.
Tea brokers said the tax was last changed in July 1991 when it was lowered to two rupees per kg from 3.50 rupees per kg.
Money collected through the tax is used to fund the work of the Tea Research Institute, the Tea Smallholders Authority and export promotion by the Tea Board.
The ministry official said bouyant tea prices also helped the government to increase the tax.
Tea prices shot to record highs late last year, mainly because of strong winter buying by the Commonwealth of Independent States, the world's biggest importer of tea. ($1=59.22 rupees)
